## What is Dakora?

Dakora is a Python library that makes it easy to manage, version, and execute LLM prompts. Think of it as **version control for your prompts** with built-in execution capabilities.

### Key Features

<CardGroup cols={2}>
  <Card
    title="Type-Safe Templates"
    icon="shield-check"
    href="/concepts/templates"
  >
    Define prompts with validated inputs and automatic type coercion
  </Card>
  <Card
    title="LLM Execution"
    icon="rocket"
    href="/features/llm-execution"
  >
    Execute templates against 100+ LLM providers with built-in cost tracking
  </Card>
  <Card
    title="Interactive Playground"
    icon="laptop"
    href="/features/playground"
  >
    Modern React UI for developing and testing templates
  </Card>
  <Card
    title="Model Comparison"
    icon="scale-balanced"
    href="/features/model-comparison"
  >
    Compare outputs across multiple models in parallel
  </Card>
</CardGroup>

## Use Case

```python
from dakora import Vault

# Load your templates
vault = Vault("dakora.yaml")

# Execute against any LLM provider
result = vault.get("summarizer").execute(
    model="gpt-4",
    input_text="Your article here..."
)

print(result.output)          # The LLM's response
print(f"${result.cost_usd}")  # Track costs automatically
```

## Why Dakora?

<AccordionGroup>
  <Accordion title="Separation of Concerns">
    Keep your prompts separate from your application code. Update prompts without redeploying your application.
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Version Control">
    Track prompt changes with semantic versioning. Know exactly which version of a prompt produced which results.
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Type Safety">
    Define input schemas with validation. Catch errors before they reach your LLM provider.
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Cost Transparency">
    Built-in tracking for tokens, latency, and costs across all providers.
  </Accordion>
</AccordionGroup>

## Quick Example

<Steps>
  <Step title="Install Dakora">
    ```bash
    pip install dakora
    ```
  </Step>

  <Step title="Initialize Project">
    ```bash
    dakora init
    ```
  </Step>

  <Step title="Create Template">
    Create `prompts/greeting.yaml`:
    ```yaml
    id: greeting
    version: 1.0.0
    template: |
      Hello {{ name }}!
      {{ message | default("Welcome!") }}
    inputs:
      name:
        type: string
        required: true
    ```
  </Step>

  <Step title="Use in Code">
    ```python
    from dakora import Vault

    vault = Vault("dakora.yaml")
    template = vault.get("greeting")

    result = template.render(name="Alice")
    print(result)  # Hello Alice! Welcome!
    ```
  </Step>
</Steps>
